intro: Sindora fusca, commonly known as the blackwood tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, dense wood and small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a small, round capsule that contains several seeds.
